    2. Learn English paleography in this BYU Script Tutorial.

  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
Basics
  1. These resources are helpful for getting started with research in England.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: England Genealogy
    ☆ LT: Beginner's Guide to Tracing British Ancestry

  2. Get an introduction to English research in this video.

    ☆ AAC—Documenting the Vital Events—3:08

  3. Learn about helpful guidelines for English research.

    ☆ BYU—English Ancestors, Getting Started
    ☆ BYU—English Ancestors, Locations

  4. Charts: Use charts and templates to aid in tracking your English research.

    ☆ Family History Charts

Basics
Records
  1. Learn about basic types of English records as you begin your research.

    ☆ AC—How to Use UK Records to Start Your Family History Research—4:48 - 2016



    ☆ BYU—Introduction to the Records—56:51 - 2016

    • Early inhabitants
    • Hereditary surnames
    • Research limits
    • Parish registers
    • Royalty
    • Crown copyright
    • Additional considerations
    • Records




  2. Go deeper into types of records for England research.

    ☆ LT—Diving into English Records: An Essential Guide for Tracing English Ancestry

  3. Timeline: Here is a timeline of events that led to creation of various record types.

    ☆ British Genealogy Timeline

  4. Tips: Get tips for finding records in the United Kingdom.

    ☆ AC—Finding Records in the United Kingdom

  5. Online Records: Explore online records for England, Wales, and the Isle of Man on the Online Genealogical Index website.
  6. Explore the ☆Forebears.io site for research records.

content.text:

  2. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.

  4. Explore ☆other research sites for England.
  5. Learn about 50 useful sites for English and Welsh genealogy.

    ☆ 50 Useful Sites for English and Welsh Genealogy

choices.name: Use QUIKLinks, Partners, and GenealogyInTime to quickly search the most common record collections for England.

content.text:
1. QUIKLinks are indicated by lightning-bolt icons in the Goals above.They point to collections with 50,000 or more records. When you click a QUIKLink icon, scroll down on the resulting page to see the QUIKLinks.
  2. In the Partners section (near the top of the page), explore additional record collections in FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast and MyHeritage.
  3. Explore the FamilySearch page for English online record collections.
  4. Get some tips on searching for English records in this video.

    ☆ AAC—Tips and tricks for successful research of English records—4:14

  5. Explore the England and Wales page of the GenealogyInTime website. Record collections are listed and described in order from newest to oldest additions, including FamilySearch, Ancestry, and many other sources.

choices.name: Join a mailing list, community, or message board for England research.

content.text:
1. Get free help with your ☆England research questions from members of the RootsChat forum.
  2. Explore the ☆British Genealogy site for UK research help.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about England research.
  4. Explore the ☆English research mailing lists available on Cyndi's List.
  5. Join the Ancestry message board for England.
  6. Explore England research questions in the ☆Genealogy Stack Exchange.
